channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MCHECKSTYLE-288] NullPointerException during building a multi-module project
item.project: Maven Checkstyle Plugin (Moved to GitHub Issues)
item.description: A NullPointerException is thrown during the execution of "mvn site" in a multi-module project, that is clearly caused by the Maven Checkstyle Plugin. The problem occurs when version 2.13 or 2.14 of the plugin is used, everything works fine when the plugin version is downgraded to version 2.12. I have attached a project in which the problem occurs.
item.summary: NullPointerException during building a multi-module project

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Please add the stacktrace of the NPE here. Run with mvn -e if necessary

Stack trace:

Duplicate of MCHECKSTYLE-250?

I'm seeing this as well (albeit using checkstyle-plugin in the validate phase), and I'm using the recommended setup from http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-checkstyle-plugin/examples/multi-module-config.html#Configure_the_other_projects_to_use_it

The problem also seems to depend on the build environment, which I find rather odd. An older version of maven works just fine:

Apache Maven 3.0.5 (r01de14724cdef164cd33c7c8c2fe155faf9602da; 2013-02-19 14:51:28+0100)
Maven home: /Applications/NetBeans/NetBeans 8.0.2.app/Contents/Resources/NetBeans/java/maven
Java version: 1.8.0_31, vendor: Oracle Corporation
Java home: /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_31.jdk/Contents/Home/jre
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8
OS name: "mac os x", version: "10.10.2", arch: "x86_64", family: "mac"

whereas a newer one has this problem

Apache Maven 3.2.3 (33f8c3e1027c3ddde99d3cdebad2656a31e8fdf4; 2014-08-11T22:58:10+02:00)
Maven home: /usr/local/Cellar/maven/3.2.3/libexec
Java version: 1.8.0_31, vendor: Oracle Corporation
Java home: /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_31.jdk/Contents/Home/jre
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8
OS name: "mac os x", version: "10.10.2", arch: "x86_64", family: "mac"

In my setup, I don't even use license header checks, so my resources project contains an empty LICENSE.txt file.
I can fix the NPE by specifying /dev/null as the <headerLocation>, but that's obviously not portable.

Hi,

I have just deployed a new 2.15-SNAPSHOT that should fix this. Please give it a try and report back.

http://maven.apache.org/guides/development/guide-testing-development-plugins.html

Hi!

I've just tried it, and as far as I can tell it does work (at least for me).
Thanks!

Hi,

Version 2.15-SNAPSHOT works fine. Thank you very much!

Waiting for a new release of the plugin

Thanks for testing!

Fixed in r1666230.

Using Maven-3.2.3 with maven-checkstyle-plugin-2.17 here and getting exactly the same issue here!

Apache Maven 3.2.3 (33f8c3e1027c3ddde99d3cdebad2656a31e8fdf4; 2014-08-11T22:58:10+02:00)

Hi Rob,

Looking at the stacktraces from the original poster and you, they look different. Your NPE occours in a different place in the code.

Please file a new issue for you problem, and attach a small project that can be used to reproduce your problem.

Recently I encountered the same problem as Rob (NPE).

The problem arose because one of the newly created modules did not contain the source code yet.

Adding source code or <packaging>pom</packaging> solves the problem.

jira-importer opened a new issue, #591:
URL: https://github.com/apache/maven-checkstyle-plugin/issues/591

**[Peter Jeszenszky](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=jeszy)** opened **MCHECKSTYLE-288(https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MCHECKSTYLE-288?redirect=false)** and commented

A NullPointerException is thrown during the execution of "mvn site" in a multi-module project, that is clearly caused by the Maven Checkstyle Plugin. The problem occurs when version 2.13 or 2.14 of the plugin is used, everything works fine when the plugin version is downgraded to version 2.12. I have attached a project in which the problem occurs.

—

*Affects:* 2.13, 2.14

*Attachments:*

  • [geocoder-parent.zip](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12714703/geocoder-parent.zip) (21.28 kB)

*Issue Links:*

  • MCHECKSTYLE-250(https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MCHECKSTYLE-250) NPE on tying to load LICENSE.txt resource from non-jar plugin dependencies

1 votes, 7 watchers

jira-importer commented on issue #591:
URL: https://github.com/apache/maven-checkstyle-plugin/issues/591#issuecomment-2969798689

**[W Herget](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=r007)** commented

I'm seeing this as well (albeit using checkstyle-plugin in the `validate` phase), and I'm using the recommended setup from http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-checkstyle-plugin/examples/multi-module-config.html#Configure_the_other_projects_to_use_it

The problem also seems to depend on the build environment, which I find rather odd. An older version of maven works just fine:

```
Apache Maven 3.0.5 (r01de14724cdef164cd33c7c8c2fe155faf9602da; 2013-02-19 14:51:28+0100)
Maven home: /Applications/NetBeans/NetBeans 8.0.2.app/Contents/Resources/NetBeans/java/maven
Java version: 1.8.0_31, vendor: Oracle Corporation
Java home: /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_31.jdk/Contents/Home/jre
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8
OS name: "mac os x", version: "10.10.2", arch: "x86_64", family: "mac"
```

whereas a newer one has this problem

```
Apache Maven 3.2.3 (33f8c3e1027c3ddde99d3cdebad2656a31e8fdf4; 2014-08-11T22:58:10+02:00)
Maven home: /usr/local/Cellar/maven/3.2.3/libexec
Java version: 1.8.0_31, vendor: Oracle Corporation
Java home: /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_31.jdk/Contents/Home/jre
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8
OS name: "mac os x", version: "10.10.2", arch: "x86_64", family: "mac"
```

In my setup, I don't even use license header checks, so my resources project contains an empty LICENSE.txt file.
I can fix the NPE by specifying `/dev/null` as the `<headerLocation>`, but that's obviously not portable.

**[Andrei Terentiev](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=aksian)** commented

Recently I encountered the same problem as Rob (NPE).

The problem arose because one of the newly created modules did not contain the source code yet.

Adding source code or \<packaging>pom\</packaging> solves the problem.
